parsed.plot: DEV: Rance questioned Gift awakening—Senta explained Firestarting or rarer untrainable Gift leveled Lisle when suppression broke during attack. Identified attackers as Karsite (red robes) disguised as bandits, taking prisoners—not random raid. Rance theorized blood magic/ritual sacrifice revival. At Waystation, Rance took herbs for Gift-shock stabilization, ate trail rations. Agreed no advance warning to Haven to avoid panic, need Mind-Healer to recover blocked trauma memories. Established contingency: Senta to knock Rance out if he loses control. Rance collapsed into Gift-shock sleep for days. Senta rode non-stop three days, reached Haven morning of fourth day. Guards alerted Healers' Collegium, Rance transferred to stretcher unconscious. Rolan (Queen's Own Companion) greeted Senta, offered rest—she refused separation. PEND: Rance's treatment and memory recovery. Identification of Gift type. Briefing Circle/Queen on Karsite attack. Fate of Lisle prisoners.

entities.c: STANCE-Rolan: Met briefly at Haven arrival, accepted his greeting but prioritized staying with Rance over rest. Now fiercely protective of Rance, refuses separation even when exhausted.

Herald-basics (knowledge of roles, protocols, Gift types) flow naturally through bond without explicit teaching. Bond strengthens over time—thoughts/emotions become clearer as minds open to each other. Creates 'something greater than sum of parts.'

Stories of ritual sacrifice/blood magic/demon summoning are historical fact, not myth. 'Fires of Vkandis Sunlord' consumed many 'impure souls' over centuries. Officially banned in Karse for decades—current revival implies major policy shift.
Queen's Own Companion. Greeted Senta at Haven arrival, offered support and reassurance about Healers. Powerful mindvoice.
